title: Welcome to My Homepage
text:
Leyi Yu is a PhD candidate in computer engineering at Case Western Reserve University.


Currently Working on


Developing a modular therapeutic ride-on car platform with 3D-printed adaptive hand controls and immersive driving games to train cognitive and fine motor skills in children with CP or TBI. This system delivers engaging, low-cost, and personalized therapy by combining outdoor driving with indoor game-based training to improve hand function and executive abilities.
Developing and deploying reinforcement learning strategies on humanoid robots
Studying an electrical-stimulation-based haptic feedback device and completing its development documentation


Previous project
Developed a hapkit-based multi-modal haptic feedback system integrated with a Unity platform jumping game.


Education
Case Western Reserve University | Cleveland, OH
PhD in Computer Engineering | In progress
